entry.title: Red Flag Warning issued July 02 at 6:29PM AKDT until July 04 at 12:00AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON MONDAY TO MIDNIGHT AKDT MONDAY NIGHT FOR DELTANA AND TANANA FLATS... The National Weather Service in Fairbanks has issued a Red Flag Warning, which is in effect from noon Monday to midnight AKDT Monday night. * AFFECTED AREA...Deltana and Tanana Flats.

entry.title: Hydrologic Outlook issued July 02 at 1:02PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Near Record Warm Temperatures Could Bring High River Levels... A heat wave arrives later this week causing temperatures to soar into the upper 70s and 80s. Warmest temperatures are expected Friday and Saturday. With these warm temperatures, increased snowmelt at elevation will increase runoff into the Chilkat River Basin. Confidence is increasing that the Chilkat River could reach minor

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 12:32PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Heat Wave Arrives Later This Week... There is an increasing potential for near record high temperatures soaring into the upper 70s and 80s throughout the Panhandle starting Thursday and continuing through Sunday. Warm temperatures will arrive as soon as Monday for some communities across the southern Panhandle, but in general, warmest

entry.title: Heat Advisory issued July 02 at 4:46PM PDT until July 05 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HEAT ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM TUESDAY TO 11 PM PDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Maximum temperatures of 92 to 102 degrees expected Tuesday and Wednesday. Hottest temperatures will be across inner portions of the Portland, Vancouver, Hillsboro, and Salem metropolitan areas.

entry.summary: ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING FOR HOT, DRY AND UNSTABLE CONDITIONS FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONE 655... The National Weather Service in Seattle has issued a Fire Weather Watch for hot, dry and unstable conditions, which is in effect from Tuesday morning through Wednesday evening.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 11:39PM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Dickenson, Buchanan, McDowell, Raleigh, Wyoming, southeastern Logan and southeastern Boone Counties through 1215 AM EDT... At 1138 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Oceana to 9 miles west of Welch to near Clintwood. Movement was east at 35 mph.
